text:
Justin Timberlake is a highly influential American singer, songwriter, and actor, often dubbed the "Prince of Pop". Born on January 31, 1981, in Memphis, Tennessee, Timberlake rose to fame as a member of the boy band 'N Sync in the late 1990s.

Timberlake began his career in the entertainment industry at a young age, singing in church choirs and competing in local talent shows. He was discovered by talent agent Lou Pearlman, who formed 'N Sync in the late 1990s. The group's debut album, "NSync," was released in 1998, but it was their second album, "No Strings Attached," released in 2000, that catapulted them to international stardom.

As a member of 'N Sync, Timberlake's soulful voice, charming stage presence, and captivating choreography made him a fan favorite. The group's hits, such as "Bye Bye Bye," "It's Gonna Be Me," and "Pop," dominated the airwaves and propelled 'N Sync to the top of the charts.

After 'N Sync went on hiatus in 2002, Timberlake pursued a successful solo music career. His debut album, "Justified," released in 2002, spawned the hit singles "Cry Me a River" and "Rock Your Body." The album earned him two Grammy Awards, including Best New Artist.

Timberlake's subsequent albums, "FutureSex/LoveSounds" (2006) and "The 20/20 Experience" (2013), further solidified his status as a pop icon. The former album, which included hits like "SexyBack" and "What Goes Around... Comes Around," cemented his status as a pioneer of the pop-rock genre.

In addition to his music career, Timberlake has also made a significant impact in the world of film. He made his acting debut in the 2006 film "Alpha Dog" and went on to star in movies like "The Social Network" (2010), "Bad Teacher" (2011), "Friends with Benefits" (2011), and "Trolls" (2016). His performance in "The Social Network" earned him a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor.

Throughout his career, Timberlake has won numerous awards, including six Grammy Awards, three Brit Awards, and an Emmy Award. He has also been named one of the most influential people in the world by Time magazine.

Justin Timberlake was born on January 31, 1981, in Memphis, Tennessee. He rose to fame as a member of the boy band 'N Sync in the late 1990s, which was formed on the Disney Channel's "The Mickey Mouse Club" alongside fellow future pop stars Britney Spears, Christina Aguilera, and JC Chasez.

In 1999, 'N Sync released their debut album "NSync" and went on to become one of the most popular boy bands of the early 2000s. The group's subsequent albums, "No Strings Attached" (2000) and "Celebrity" (2001), solidified their position as teen heartthrobs.

In 2002, Justin Timberlake decided to pursue a solo music career, releasing his debut album "Justified," which featured the hit singles "Like I Love You" and "Cry Me a River." His sophomore album "FutureSex/LoveSounds" (2006) debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart and spawned the iconic singles "SexyBack," "My Love," and "What Goes Around... Comes Around."

Apart from music, Timberlake also made a name for himself in Hollywood. He made his acting debut in 2003 with the comedy film "Edtv" and went on to star in films like "Alpha Dog" (2006), "The Social Network" (2010), and "Bad Teacher" (2011). His notable performances earned him several award nominations, including an Academy Award nomination for Best Original Song for "Can't Stop the Feeling!" from the 2016 film "Trolls."

In 2013, Justin Timberlake married actress Jessica Biel, and they have two sons together. Throughout his career, he has won numerous awards, including six Grammy Awards, and has been named one of Time Magazine's 100 most influential people in the world.

Justin Timberlake's versatility, charismatic stage presence, and iconic hits have cemented his status as a beloved pop star and actor.

Justin Randall Timberlake was born on January 31, 1981, in Memphis, Tennessee. He grew up in a family of musicians and began singing and performing at a young age. Timberlake rose to fame in the late 1990s as a member of the boy band NSYNC, alongside JC Chasez, Chris Kirkpatrick, Joey Fatone, and Lance Bass.

During his time with NSYNC, Timberlake was known for his powerful vocals, captivating stage presence, and heartthrob status. The group released several successful albums, including "NSYNC" (1998), "Home for Christmas" (1998), "No Strings Attached" (2000), and "Celebrity" (2001). Some of their most popular hits include "Bye Bye Bye", "It's Gonna Be Me", and "Pop".

In 2002, Timberlake launched a successful solo music career with the release of his debut album "Justified", which featured the hit singles "Cry Me a River" and "Rock Your Body". His subsequent albums, "FutureSex/LoveSounds" (2006), "The 20/20 Experience" (2013), and "The 20/20 Experience – 2 of 2" (2013), solidified his status as a solo artist.

In addition to his music career, Timberlake has also had a successful acting career. He made his film debut in the 2003 comedy "Edison", and went on to star in movies such as "The Social Network" (2010), "Bad Teacher" (2011), "Friends with Benefits" (2011), and "Trolls" (2016). He received critical acclaim for his role as Sean Parker in "The Social Network", which earned him a nomination for the Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor.

Timberlake has won numerous awards for his music and acting, including six Grammy Awards, three American Music Awards, and four MTV Video Music Awards. He has also been named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world.

In 2012, Timberlake married actress Jessica Biel, and they have two sons together. He continues to be one of the most successful and beloved artists in the entertainment industry, known for his versatility, creativity, and captivating stage presence.

In addition to his music career, Timberlake has also made a successful transition to acting. He made his film debut in 2003's "Edison" and went on to appear in movies like "The Social Network" (2010), "Bad Teacher" (2011), "Friends with Benefits" (2011), and "Trolls" (2016). He received critical acclaim for his performance as Sean Parker in "The Social Network," earning a Golden Globe nomination.

Timberlake has been married to actress Jessica Biel since 2012, and they have two sons together. Throughout his career, he has been recognized with numerous awards and accolades, including an American Music Award, a Brit Award, and a MTV Video Music Award.

Known for his versatility, charisma, and dedication to his craft, Justin Timberlake has established himself as a talented and influential artist in both music and film.

In addition to his music career, Timberlake has also made a significant impact in the film industry. His performance in the critically acclaimed "The Social Network" earned him a Golden Globe nomination for Best Supporting Actor.

Throughout his career, Timberlake has won numerous awards, including several Grammy Awards, American Music Awards, and MTV Video Music Awards. He has also been recognized for his philanthropic efforts, particularly in the area of education and children's welfare.

Today, Justin Timberlake remains one of the most successful and beloved entertainers in the world, known for his versatile talent, charming stage presence, and dedication to his craft.

It's never too late to share a short bio on Justin Timberlake!

Justin Randall Timberlake was born on January 31, 1981, in Memphis, Tennessee. He grew up in a family of modest means and began singing in his church choir at a young age. Timberlake's music career began in the late 1990s as a member of the boy band 'N Sync, which became one of the most popular acts of the early 2000s. During his time with the group, Timberlake released several hit albums, including "NSync" and "No Strings Attached," and had numerous chart-topping singles like "Bye Bye Bye" and "It's Gonna Be Me."

After 'N Sync went on hiatus, Timberlake launched a successful solo music career, releasing his debut album "Justified" in 2002. The album spawned hit singles like "Cry Me a River" and "Rock Your Body." He went on to release several more albums, including "FutureSex/LoveSounds" (2006), "The 20/20 Experience" (2013), and "Man of the Woods" (2018). Throughout his solo career, Timberlake has collaborated with artists like Timbaland, Jay-Z, and Pharrell Williams, among others.

In addition to his music, Timberlake has also had a successful acting career. He made his film debut in the 2006 musical comedy "The Love Guru" and went on to appear in movies like "Bad Teacher" (2011), "Friends with Benefits" (2011), and "Trolls" (2016). His most notable role to date is probably his portrayal of Sean Parker in the 2010 biographical drama "The Social Network," for which he received critical acclaim.

Throughout his career, Timberlake has won numerous awards, including multiple Grammy Awards, American Music Awards, and Billboard Music Awards. He has also been named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world.

Off-screen, Timberlake is married to actress Jessica Biel and has two sons with her. He is also a co-owner of the Memphis-based restaurant, Southern Hospitality, and has been involved in various charitable endeavors, including the Shriners Hospitals for Children and the National Geographic's Photo Ark.

That's a brief look at the remarkable career and life of Justin Timberlake – the "Prince of Pop"!
